about_text:
I'm Amit Malka, 28 years old, I hold a bachelor's degree in biotechnology-Bio Data and have experience in both laboratory settings and data analysis.
I've worked in MyHeritage's COVID-19 lab, focusing on RNA extraction and team management. This role honed my problem-solving skills and commitment to excellence.

During my degree, I completed a single-cell RNA sequencing data analysis project using R, which significantly enhanced my data analysis skills.

Currently enrolled in an intensive AI Development program at Ben-Gurion University (110-hour program, June-September 2025), gaining hands-on expertise in large language models, intelligent agent development, and RAG systems. This specialized training equips me to architect sophisticated AI solutions that transform business challenges into opportunities through cutting-edge technologies and implementation strategies.

My technical skills include:
projects_intro: Explore my portfolio showcasing advanced data analysis projects that demonstrate my expertise in transforming complex data into meaningful insights.
project_rna_brief: Advanced computational pipeline for analyzing gene expression using machine learning approaches in hypertension research.
project_rna_content:
As a pioneer at the MIGAL Research Institute, I developed a comprehensive computational pipeline for single-cell RNA sequencing analysis. This groundbreaking project established a foundation for future researchers in the field.

The project focused on analyzing extensive gene expression datasets from three distinct rat models, investigating the effects of EPA lactone on hypertension. My work encompassed:
â€¢ Rigorous data quality control and preprocessing
â€¢ Advanced dimensionality reduction techniques
â€¢ Sophisticated cell clustering and identification
â€¢ Complex statistical analysis of treatment effects
â€¢ Development of intuitive data visualizations

View Project on GitHub
cv_no_pdf: Your browser does not support PDF viewing. Click here to download the file
intro_desc:
Curious data analyst transitioning to AI development with strong foundation in programming and statistical analysis.
Currently advancing expertise in Large Language Models and AI agent development through intensive training at The Institute AI(Ben-Gurion University).
slider_umap: Classification of cells into clusters using UMAP, each point represents a gene expression profile of a cell. Color sorting was based on gene expression similarity.
slider_marker: Pf4 is a genetic marker for immune system cells (encoded for a cytokine in blood platelets).
slider_identity: Based on genetic markers I discovered the cell types in each cluster.
slider_volcano: Volcano plot shows that lactone treatment reduces the effect of hypertension on gene expression in endothelial cells.
project_cve_brief: Interactive dashboard analyzing Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures trends (1999-2020).
project_cve_content:
An end-to-end analytics project delivering comprehensive insights into cybersecurity vulnerability trends using predictive analytics and automated insight generation. The dashboard combines advanced data processing with interactive visualization to transform raw CVE data into actionable intelligence, demonstrating principles fundamental to AI-driven business intelligence.

Key Features:
â€¢ Dynamic filtering by year range and severity levels
â€¢ Real-time KPI tracking (Total CVEs, Avg CVSS Score, Patch Response Time)
â€¢ Predictive trend analysis with statistical correlations and forecasting
â€¢ Automated pattern recognition in access vector distributions
â€¢ Top 10 CWE (Common Weakness Enumeration) categories with risk scoring
â€¢ Intelligent alerting system for anomaly detection

Technologies Used:
â€¢ Splunk for data processing and SPL queries (similar to modern data pipelines)
â€¢ Power BI for interactive dashboard creation with embedded analytics
â€¢ DAX for advanced calculations and predictive modeling
â€¢ Statistical analysis and machine learning principles (Pearson correlation, RÂ² analytics)
project_ai_brief: Advanced analytics platform for analyzing and visualizing AI's impact on global media trends.
project_ai_content:
An advanced analytics platform that visualizes and analyzes the impact of Artificial Intelligence on global media and communication trends. The system processes historical data to identify key trends and provides actionable insights through interactive visualizations and AI-powered analysis.

Key Features:
â€¢ Interactive comparative analysis of AI adoption rates between countries and industries
â€¢ Performance metrics and growth pattern tracking
â€¢ Smart insights engine with trend detection
â€¢ Dynamic data visualization
â€¢ Custom filtering and time-based analysis

Technologies:
â€¢ Python & Streamlit - Interactive UI development
â€¢ Pandas & NumPy - Data processing and analysis
â€¢ Plotly - Interactive visualizations
â€¢ Hugging Face Transformers - Advanced text analysis
â€¢ PyTorch - Advanced model infrastructure
skills_python: Python - Advanced analytics with Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.
skills_r: R - Statistical modeling with dplyr, ggplot2, and tidyverse ecosystem
skills_sql: SQL - Complex data querying, optimization, and database design
skills_powerbi: Power BI - Interactive dashboards, DAX, and data modeling
skills_react: React - Building responsive and interactive web applications
skills_js: TypeScript/JavaScript - Modern ES6+ development practices
skills_css: CSS - Modern layouts with Flexbox, Grid, and responsive design
skills_llm: Large Language Models (LLMs) & Transformer Architecture
skills_agents: AI Agent Development with Memory & Reasoning
skills_prompt: Prompt Engineering & Model Fine-tuning
skills_vector: Vector Databases & Semantic Search
skills_tools: Modern AI Development Tools (Cursor, Windsurf)
skills_team: Team Collaboration - Experience in agile environments and cross-functional teams
skills_fast: Fast Learner - Proven ability to quickly master new technologies and frameworks
skills_project: Project Management - End-to-end project ownership and delivery
about_summary:
I combine analytical expertise with software development skills to create comprehensive data solutions. My background in biotechnology adds unique perspective to problem-solving, while my technical skills enable me to build efficient, scalable applications.

I'm particularly interested in roles that combine data analysis with modern web development, where I can leverage my full stack of skills to create impactful solutions.
project_rna_content_intro: As a pioneer at the MIGAL Research Institute, I developed a comprehensive computational pipeline for single-cell RNA sequencing analysis applying machine learning methodologies. This groundbreaking project established a foundation for future researchers while demonstrating core principles now essential in AI development.
project_rna_bullet1: Rigorous data quality control and preprocessing (foundational for ML pipeline development)
project_rna_bullet2: Advanced dimensionality reduction techniques (similar to embedding spaces in LLMs)
project_rna_bullet3: Sophisticated cell clustering and identification (unsupervised learning applications)
project_rna_bullet4: Complex statistical analysis and pattern recognition (core AI/ML methodology)
project_rna_bullet5: Development of intuitive data visualizations and interpretability frameworks
ai_journey_intro: My transition from data analysis to AI development through structured learning and hands-on experience.
timeline_desc_1: Built strong foundation in statistical analysis, programming, and computational biology through biotechnology degree and research projects.
timeline_desc_2: Currently enrolled in intensive 110-hour AI Development program at Ben-Gurion University, specializing in LLMs and intelligent agents.
timeline_desc_3: Implementing real-world AI solutions including RAG systems, chatbots, and automation tools as part of coursework.
timeline_desc_4: Seeking opportunities to apply AI expertise in innovative projects while continuing to expand knowledge in emerging technologies.
